content.description: The overhanging, left leaning wall that trends up above Main Cliff. Start on the sloped landing under the feature on a small crimp rail. Pull hard to get a heel up and slap onto the arete. Continue moving left crimps and right hand arete holds to top out slightly up and left. Fun feature, surprising good rock, although somewhat fragile.
content.protection: Pad, preferably a spotter to keep you on the slope!
content.location: On top of the first section of Main Cliff, find the left leaning ramp and look for the clean(er) section that holds this problem.

content.description: Mantle into the choss shelf, and be careful not to knock bits of rock down. There is a good (and solid!) crimp rail at the lip that will allow you to set up for a throw to a jug high up. The rock from here is solid, but the top out is committing and will likely require cleaning for future attempts.
content.protection: A pad or two, spotter likely preferred. Not really a good thing to fall on...
content.location: On the left side of the bottom of Main Cliff, find the incredibly chossy shelf as the cliff rounds to the left.

content.description:
The first cliff area you come to, routes are generally 35ft, though many have returned to a mossy state.  

  When looking at the map in the photos section, be aware that both problems graded V3 are somewhere between V4 and V5 with less than ideal landings. 

  Two routes worth doing are Floating Point Precision and Increased Resistance.
